By the late 24th century, Denobula appears in Starfleet strategic context as an allied world.

KeyEras.Summary: Genetic engineering is described as being used on Denobula to repair genetic deficiencies, not to redesign the species.
Denobula is repeatedly referenced as Phlox’s homeworld; Humans participate in an interspecies medical exchange, and Denobula takes part in Coalition-era diplomatic efforts.
Denobula is shown as a Starfleet ally on a strategic display (as referenced in animated canon).
Denobula is listed as habitable in 32nd-century-era references.

MajorEvents.Event: Genetic engineering on Denobula is described as being used to correct deficiencies rather than to 'improve' the species.
Human doctor Jeremy Lucas serves on Denobula as part of an interspecies medical exchange.
A Denobulan representative participates in talks at Starfleet Headquarters to form the Coalition of Planets.
Denobula appears on a Starfleet strategic display as an allied world.

Government.Polity: Planetary government (name/structure unknown); Denobula is represented diplomatically in Coalition-era talks.
Institutions: Denobulan planetary government (unnamed; represented by an ambassador/representative in 2155)
Denobulan scientific and medical community (frequently referenced through Phlox and Denobulan colleagues)
Weather-tower infrastructure administration (implied by planet-scale climate engineering)
Government.Notes: On-screen canon emphasizes Denobula’s culture and major infrastructure more than its formal governmental structure.

Economy.Overview: Denobula’s economic model is not described in on-screen canon; the planet is characterized instead by dense urban life, strong social cohesion, and advanced engineering and medical science.
Economy.TradeNotes: Interstellar trade routes are implied, but specific exports/imports and trade partners are unknown.
Economy.LocalCommerceNotes: Local businesses (including nightlife venues) are referenced, but pricing and currency systems are unknown.

Culture.Overview: Denobulan culture is portrayed as optimistic and strongly communal, with many people choosing to live in close proximity on a single continent. Family and relationship structures commonly involve multiple spouses and large extended networks.
Culture.SocialCustoms: Communal living and large social gatherings are culturally valued. Denobulan relationship norms are polyamorous; Phlox references multiple spouses and extended family connections as ordinary.
Culture.Festivals: Mating season is referenced as a socially active period; other festivals are unknown.

Environment.Overview: A single-continent habitable planet with significant storm activity historically severe enough to motivate the construction of weather towers. Additional environmental specifics (biomes beyond urbanized regions, oceans, and polar conditions) are unknown.

Appearances.Overview: Denobula is primarily referenced as Phlox’s homeworld; it is mentioned frequently but not visited or depicted in an extended on-screen setting.

Highlights: Referenced as the Denobulan homeworld and in medical/diplomatic contexts across multiple episodes.
Referenced in relation to Denobulan weather-tower technology and later-era context.
Listed on a Starfleet strategic display as an ally (2384).

Episodes: ENT: "Dear Doctor" (Denobula referenced; population density, culture, and Kaybin District context)
ENT: "The Catwalk" (Denobula referenced; population on a single continent)
ENT: "Doctor's Orders" (Denobula referenced; communal culture and density)
ENT: "Demons" / "Terra Prime" (Denobula representative in Coalition of Planets talks)
ENT: "Borderland" (Denobulan genetic engineering referenced)
DIS: "Whistlespeak" (Denobulan weather-tower technology referenced in later era)
PRO: "Supernova, Part 1" (Denobula shown as Starfleet ally on strategic display, 2384)
CanonAppearances.Notes: Denobula is largely established through dialogue and indirect references; extended on-screen planetary visuals are not provided.
